description: Installation of an internally illuminated fascia sign and a projecting sign
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - No advertisement is to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission.

Condition : 2 - No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as 

(a)	endanger persons using any public highway, railway, waterway, dock, harbour or aerodrome (civil or military);

(b)	obscure, or hinder the ready interpretation of, any traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air; or

(c)	hinder the operation of any device used for the purpose of security or surveillance or for measuring the speed of any vehicle.
Condition : 3 - Any advertisement displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements, shall be maintained in a condition that does not impair the visual amenity of the site.
Condition : 4 - Where an advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the site shall be left in a condition that does not endanger the public or impair visual amenity.
Condition : 5 - The period of express consent expires five years from the date of this decision.

Condition : 6 - The internal illumination intensity of the two signs hereby approved shall not exceed 300 candelas per square metre (as measured from any part of the sign) during hours of darkness.  
Reasons:  To prevent excessive illumination from adversely affecting the character and appearance of the area, neighbour living conditions and highway safety in accordance with Local Plan Policies CC1 (Context and Character), CC2 (Urban Design and Architecture), CC4 (Heritage), EQ6 (Lighting) and EC2 (Developing a Sustainable Transport Network).

Condition : 7 - The signs hereby approved shall not include moving features, animation, intermittent flashing light sources, changing colours or exposed cold cathode tubing and shall be permanently retained as such.  
Reasons:  To protect the character and appearance of the area, neighbour living conditions and highway safety, in accordance with Local Plan Policies CC1 (Context and Character), CC2 (Urban Design and Architecture), CC4 (Heritage), EQ6 (Lighting) and EC2 (Developing a Sustainable Transport Network).

Condition : 8 - No part of the public footway/ carriageway shall be blocked, and no traffic flow or driver visibility splays shall be obstructed, during the construction or maintenance of the signs hereby approved.  
Reasons: To prevent harm to highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with Local Plan Policy EC2 (Developing a Sustainable Transport Network).
